snippet: A change in the length of kickoffs to protect returners from concussions is working — and is cutting into their production.
abstract: NFL Roundup; more than half of all kickoffs could end up as touchbacks in current season for first time in NFL history, three years after league moved up the kickoff to reduce number of returns and concussions; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: A change in the length of kickoffs to protect returners from concussions is working — and is cutting into their production.

headline.print_headline: For Kick-Return Specialists, Opportunity Knocked Out of Reach
